title: Subtracting 20 from x is the same as multiplying x by what number? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let y be the number by which x is multiplied xy = x-20 y = (x-20)/x As it is not mentioned that x is positive or negative number etc. So we will take x as a real number. According to infinite values of x we have infinite values of y also. For some values (1) If x = 2 y = (x-20)/x y=(2–20)/2 =-18/2 = -9 So if x = 2 we can multiply it by -9 (2) If x= 4 y = (x-20)/x y=(4–20)/4 =-16/4 =-4 So if x = 4 we can multiply it by -4 Like this we can find infinite combinations of x and y.

Let p is to be multiples with x x-20=px p=(x-20)/x=1–20/x p=1–20/x assuming p is an integer then x should factor of 20 factors of 20 are 1,2,4,5,10,20 p=-19,-9,-4,-3,-1,0 Thus 5 positive values of x are possible similarly x=-1,-2,-4,-5,-10,–20 then p=21,11,6,5,3,,2 Thus the multiplier p can have ,following value if p is an integer positive or negative -19,-9,-4,-3,-1,0,21,11,6,5,3,,2
